article.title: Perturbative and global anomalies in bosonic analogues of integer quantum Hall and topological insulator phases

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the equation SCS[A] = 1/4π ∫ A ∧ dA represent?
choices: Chern-Simons term describing electromagnetic response of an integer quantum Hall state.
Wess-Zumino term for a nonlinear sigma model.
Parity anomaly of a Dirac fermion in three dimensions.
Bulk electromagnetic response of a bosonic topological insulator state.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the equation SCC[A] = Θ/8π² ∫ F ∧ F, with Θ = 2π, represent?
choices: Chern-Simons term describing the response of a bosonic integer quantum Hall state.
Wess-Zumino term for a nonlinear sigma model with Wess-Zumino term.
Parity anomaly of a Dirac fermion in three dimensions.
Bulk electromagnetic response of a bosonic topological insulator state.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the equation ω2m-1 = Σ a=1 to 2m (-1)^(a-1) n^a dn^1 ∧ ... ∧ dn^(a-1) ∧ ... ∧ dn^2m represent?
choices: Volume form on the (2m-1)-dimensional unit sphere S^(2m-1).
Kinetic term for a nonlinear sigma model.
Wess-Zumino term for a nonlinear sigma model.
Gauge transformation of a bosonic field.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the transformation U(1): b_ℓ → e^(iξ) b_ℓ, ∀ℓ describe?
choices: Gauge transformation of a bosonic field.
Action of the U(1) symmetry on the bosons in the nonlinear sigma model of a bosonic integer quantum Hall state.
Action of the Z2 symmetry on the bosons in the nonlinear sigma model of a bosonic topological insulator state.
Smooth deformation of the target space of a nonlinear sigma model.
